text: BdB says the day "will come" that NYC Ferry is integrated w/ MTA fares. He gives full-throated defense of his ferry program; says ferries very popular with NYers & the city absolutely needs more "mass transit" options, which he can prove if you come onto the subways with him.
author: TweetBenMax

text: oh no
author: TweetBenMax

text: BdB presser turns into debate on congestion pricing as, after press Q re where things stand in Albany, state legislators express their concerns with it & give status reports. BdB jumps in to say people have different opinions but we need a state plan to fund subways by April 1.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Public Advocate @JumaaneWilliams announces transition committee that will help him staff up & reorganize the office, chaired by @ljoywilliams @markjgreen @IfyWorks, & members including:
author: TweetBenMax

text: State legislators at the presser - @JSandersNYC, @BrianABenjamin, @AMBichotte - say they know there's some support already and they expect to build more. Expressing a lot of confidence on this MWBE contracting shift.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Asked about the timing of this announcement by @Jill_Jorgensen, BdB says the hope is by end of legislative session in June. Says inclusion in budget, due April 1, would be nice, but eyeing longer timeline here as legislators intro bill on Monday.
author: TweetBenMax

text: an MTA secession threat here from upstate legislators
author: TweetBenMax

text: what's the word for when you're proud of something you should be embarrassed about
author: TweetBenMax

text: There are several Democratic state legislators at this press conference, so perhaps they're making a push on this and can get an increase in the discretionary MWBE contracting limit into the budget.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Per press release, the city awarded $3.7 billion to M/WBEs last year, up from $1.6 billion in 2015. (@NYCComptroller has pushed the city fairly hard on this issue and seemingly gotten action at times; BdB has made quite a few M/WBE shifts over the years)
author: TweetBenMax

text: Strange timing aside, gist here is MWBE firms don't have to go thru more rigorous bidding process on these "discretionary" contracts. MWBEs are often smaller & don't have as much internal infrastructure. BdB says shift could allow city to invest $500M more annually with MWBEs.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Fewer than 10 days before state budget is due, Mayor de Blasio is unveiling a new proposal he wants state lawmakers to include. He's having a press conference on M/WBE contracting, wants the state to lift the limit on "discretionary" MWBE contracting to $1 million from $150K.
author: TweetBenMax

text: "you have the worst jail in the state in your city," @NYGovCuomo says with an edge, having moved to discussing Rikers Island in a long answer about having had a conversation with Minority Leader John Flanagan about the budget
author: TweetBenMax

text: Asked about extending film tax credit, Cuomo mischaracterizes @NYSenDems position, saying the Senate Dems opposed Amazon b/c opposed to tax credits. Not anywhere near that simple, & Senate Dems have not come out in blanket oppo to all tax credits.
author: TweetBenMax

text: "it is a complication, yes, but i don't think it's determinative," Cuomo says of marijuana legalization vis a vis fact that both Long Island counties indicate they plan to opt out of allowing sales if legalized.
author: TweetBenMax

text:
Cuomo & his counsel again indicate key sticking point in criminal justice reforms (bail, discovery, speedy trial) is the law around pre-trial detention if you eliminate cash bail & make other changes - what triggers pre-trial incarceration?

Background:
author: TweetBenMax

text: News of sorts: Cuomo says driver's licenses for all - allowing undocumented immigrants access to licenses - is not currently on the table for the budget, but could come up after the budget & he is open to moving on it.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Cuomo says must be very careful w budget & need permanent tax cap for measure of "stability" & inject more "confidence" into the market - he says "anecdotally" they're hearing about slowing home sales in Westchester & on Long Island. Says NYers are nervous about taxes & impacts.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Cuomo says "you can't commit to doing a budget on-time," you can try to do it on-time, but can't do a bad budget just to be on-time. As governor, Cuomo has had a near-obsession - which many have been happy about - to get budgets done on time, & that's mostly happened 2011-2018.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Cuomo adds MTA reform & congestion pricing to his musts list. Says even BdB now agrees to congestion pricing.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Cuomo says Dems have been "talking for 7 years" about criminal justice & campaign finance reform, so now time to get it done. Says permanent property tax cap is a must b/c of federal tax reform (tho, as @CarlHeastie points out, the current cap doesn't expire till next year).
author: TweetBenMax

text: Cuomo says he believes everyone's negotiating in good faith (a lot to unpack there). Says all want to get budget done on-time but he's not sure will. He's been clear on his musts, he says: careful $ #s, criminal justice reform, permanent property tax cap, campaign finance reform.
author: TweetBenMax

text: Asked about state budget getting done & on-time, & told legislative leaders optimistic, Cuomo pushed back on that notion by going through a list of challenges. Says "it is a tough budget to do on the numbers" among other things.
author: TweetBenMax

text: "It is a disaster waiting to happen," Cuomo says of Hudson tunnels. "And everybody knows it!" He says Trump & Feds acknowledge problems w tunnels but not acting. Calls it "political retaliation" b/c NY/NJ "states that did not vote for the president...primarily Democratic states."
author: TweetBenMax

text: Cuomo has called this press conference to specifically discuss the Gateway Tunnel project & lack of Fed funds. He says it's a federal tunnel - a "Trump tunnel" & should be branded as such. "It's not our tunnel, it's not our property," he says. "It is our problem..."
author: TweetBenMax

text: Cuomo says NY currently negotiating a budget w big unknowns hanging over it. Federal budget; NY taxpayer behavior & state tax revenue. Cuomo recently discussed at length how current environment adds credence to idea of moving state fiscal year from April 1 to July 1.
author: TweetBenMax

text: "The Amazon competition was just a high-profile version of what goes on everyday," @NYGovCuomo says, discussing how he believes the federal gov't, via tax reform & its SALT cap, has hurt New York, which is constantly trying to lure companies to the state with incentives.
author: TweetBenMax

text: it's also true (i've said this many times) that de Blasio's goal of reducing the shelter population to 57,500 by 2022 is woefully insufficient, equivalent to saying that as long as homelessness isn't increasing, that's about all we can do right now.
author: TweetBenMax

text: it's both true that de Blasio has not done well enough designing and managing the city's response to the homelessness crisis AND that he's done a lot of impactful things and 'broken the trajectory' as Steve Banks likes to say
author: TweetBenMax

text:
the homeless shelter population in the city rose steadily from 2006 through 2017, with sharper jumps from 2010 to 2017, but has more or less leveled off since, at around 60,000.

it's at 60,200 as of Sunday; was at 60,100 to start 2018.
author: TweetBenMax

text: if you look at a graph of homelessness in New York City over the last few decades, just about every commissioner tasked with reducing the number of homeless people has overseen an all-time high
author: TweetBenMax

text: .@RJackson_NYC asks BdB if he'd be open to a system where he gets to appoint the same # of PEP members but can't remove them until their term in expired. BdB says in 5 years he hasn't removed a PEP member, but wants the flexibility to do so, tho he'd be clear to public as to why.

text: "mayoral control is a dictatorship" says Senator @RJackson_NYC, who then points out that the state legislature has oversight of mayoral control of schools & can decide whether to renew it.

text: Did not know this: Senator @agounardes just said at mayoral control hearing that he was the first student member of the Panel for Educational Policy (PEP). He says he's a strong proponent of mayoral control, but wants more responsiveness to parents from DOE.
